item.title: Volunteer race marshal dies in Brands Hatch crash
item.description: The marshal died in an accident during a race at the track, leading to the cancellation of the event.

item.title: Video: Eggborough Power Station cooling towers demolished
item.description: The 300ft (90m) high structures in Eggborough were demolished as part of a plan to redevelop the site.

item.title: Gorleston man charged with murder of Pat Holland
item.description: A 41-year-old man is charged with the murder of Pat Holland, 83, who was last seen a week ago.

item.title: Tokyo Olympics: Corby BMX centre 'so proud' of British medals
item.description: Mandy Young set up an urban sports centre after her son was attacked and had his skateboard stolen.

item.title: In pictures: Camp Bestival returns to Dorset after year off
item.description: Camp Bestival returns to Lulworth Castle with performances by Groove Armada and Mr Tumble.

item.title: Birmingham murder case police identify stabbing victim
item.description: Police said they could not trace any family of Brahane Yordanos who was found on Saturday.

item.title: Tokyo Olympics: Max Whitlock and Charlotte Worthington land gold on day nine
item.description: Charlotte Worthington wins a dramatic BMX park freestyle Olympic gold as Max Whitlock retains pommel horse title.

item.title: Bristol teenager in "unbearable" pain due to eczema
item.description: Miranda Rae says her son Barney is in constant pain and is pinning her hopes on a drug in the US.

item.title: Sutton Hoo-era Norfolk sword pyramid find 'lost by lord'
item.description: The tiny object was found by a metal detectorist and is inlaid with Indian or Sri Lankan garnets.

item.title: Shipdham death: Murder arrest as woman dies at house
item.description: Police officers were called to an address in Shipdham, near Dereham, on Sunday afternoon.

item.title: Covid: Which children are being vaccinated and why?
item.description: Hundreds of thousands of children at higher risk from coronavirus infection will be offered a Covid vaccine in the UK.

item.title: Why you shouldn't get a second Covid jab too early
item.description: A government scientific advisor tells Newsbeat why four weeks is too soon between Covid jabs.

item.title: Beta coronavirus variant: What is the risk?
item.description: There are fears that this version of coronavirus, first identified in South Africa, is

item.title: Covid rules: How can the clinically vulnerable stay safe?
item.description: As social-distancing and other Covid rules end in England, how can people who were shielding stay safe?

item.title: What are the rules and guidance for face masks and coverings from 19 July?
item.description: Masks are no longer compulsory in England, but remain necessary in Scotland and Wales.

item.title: 'Erotic, maybe a bit sexy, but not pornographic'
item.description: Alison Walker signed up for a boudoir photoshoot before having a double mastectomy.

item.title: The autistic-friendly toy shop: 'We have got this'
item.description: Retail worker Romilly, who is autistic, wants to create a comfortable space for other autistic people to shop in.

item.title: Dorset photographer shoots Star Wars Lego in cinematic style
item.description: A 34-year-old Dorset photographer is recreating cinematic sci-fi scenes using his Star Wars Lego kits.

item.title: 'Bennerley Viaduct has Facebook followers in Germany'
item.description: The Victorian rail bridge was almost demolished but now has fans all over the world.

item.title: Jersey teenager asking world leaders for advice
item.description: Leo, 18, sent 200 letters asking for life advice and wisdom from leaders around the globe.

item.title: Birmingham city centre attack: Arrest as man dies
item.description: The 33-year-old died in hospital after being assaulted in Birmingham city centre.

item.title: Louise Kam: Two arrested as police seek missing woman
item.description: Louise Kam was last seen in a shopping centre in Barnet, north-west London, on Monday.

item.title: 'Exploitative' Elephant Man dissection to go ahead
item.description: A replica of Joseph Merrick's body will be dissected at the event.

item.title: Norwich deaths: Bodies of man and woman found in house
item.description: The deaths are currently being treated as unexplained, Norfolk Police say.

item.title: High Wycombe: Murder arrests after man found dead in street
item.description: A group of men flee the scene when police officers on patrol arrive to find the man on the ground.

item.title: Hastings sewage leak: Bulverhythe hut owner 'devastated'
item.description: Repairs to the very large sewage pipe are ongoing, as is the clean up of the flooded beach front.

item.title: Nottinghamshire Victorian signal box reopens as museum
item.description: A man who helped to save the dilapidated structure says it will reopen as a museum this weekend.

item.title: Lewis Hamilton suspects he has long Covid after Hungarian Grand Prix
item.description: Lewis Hamilton says he has been battling with his health this year after contracting Covid-19 last December.

item.title: Tokyo Olympics: Max Whitlock defends Olympic pommel horse title
item.description: Great Britain's Max Whitlock produces a sublime performance to defend his Olympic title by winning gold in the men's pommel horse.

item.title: Shane Warne: London Spirit head coach tests positive for Covid-19
item.description: London Spirit head coach Shane Warne tests positive for Covid-19 and will miss their next fixture.
